speaker: Episode 52 - The Suffering Game - Chapter Two
Griffin
lines: Previously, on the Adventure Zone…

speaker: [theme music begins playing in the background]
Griffin
lines: And she pulls out a flier and it’s really gaudy. It is advertising in big, colorful block letters a place called Wonderland.

speaker: The Director
lines: On this flier is an image, and it is in fact a grand relic. As the flier says, it’s the Animus Bell. My journey through Wonderland was hell. I wagered 20 years of my life in a game of chess in Wonderland, and I lost.

speaker: Griffin
lines: And then an arrow comes in and hits that goat head and with that the chimera just instantly falls to the ground dead. You see a few people. You see, a, uh, half-elf man who is kind of gruff. With him you see a wood elf, you see a kind of scrawny human man who is no older than like 20 years old, probably. He is Lord Artemis Sterling, the ruler of Neverwinter, and the most powerful man in the world.

speaker: Announcer
lines: What will our boys find in Wonderland? Well, this arc’s called “The Suffering Game”, so...nothing great! It’s the Adventure Zone!

speaker: [THEME MUSIC
lines: "Déjà Vu" by Mort Garson (full song on YouTube)]

speaker: Griffin
lines: Are you guys good? Are you guys- are you guys ready to be whisked away?

speaker: Clint
lines: Uh—

speaker: Travis
lines: Whisk, whisk, whisk.

speaker: Clint
lines: I have—I have a little concern.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Okay.

speaker: Clint
lines: What—why is this arc called “The Suffering Game”?

speaker: Griffin
lines: Oh, don’t worry about that, Dad.

speaker: Clint
lines: Why? Why, Griffin?

speaker: Griffin
lines: Aw, Daddy, don’t worry about it. I—I would never—

speaker: Clint
lines: What’s in the box? What’s in the boooxx?

speaker: Travis
lines: No, Dad, it’s like when you call like a big guy “Tiny”, or you know what I mean?

speaker: Griffin
lines: Yeah.

speaker: Travis
lines: Or like, a little guy “Biggie”?

speaker: Clint
lines: Okay, so it’s really the “The Celebrating Game.”

speaker: Griffin
lines: That’s exactly right, Dad.

speaker: Clint
lines: Heh, okay, I feel a little better now. I’ve been concerned.

speaker: Griffin
lines: No, you have nothing to worry about. So, um, at the end of the last episode you encountered these three people. You, uh, see a half-elf guy with a big old long-bow dressed in pelts, with a short, shaggy, uh, beard and dark red hair. There’s an elven woman with, uh, dark purple hair and she’s got a gnarled wooden staff and the same sort of pelt armor. And you see Lord Artemis Sterling, the Lord of Highwin—of Neverwinter, um, and he’s holding a shortbow, and um, he’s kind of standing behind the two elves, and, he’s, he’s dressed in this finery, and he looks at the three of you, and he says, uh. I need a voice for this boy. He says, uh...

speaker: Clint
lines: Oh, use the king from uh, Hamilton. That’ll be good.

speaker: Lord Artemis Sterling
lines: [obnoxious voice] Who are you? Have you been following us?

speaker: Travis
lines: Nah, I’m not gonna deal with this for the whole arc, Griffin.

speaker: Lord Artemis Sterling
lines: [same voice but a little more nerd] What’s wrong? It’s me. Lord Artemis Sterling.

speaker: Travis
lines: Nah, nah, nah.

speaker: Lord Artemis Sterling
lines: Have you been following us? Have you been following us, the whole time?

speaker: Travis
lines: I’m not gonna deal with Berries and Cream for this whole episode, Griffin.

speaker: Griffin
lines: That’s what you got. When you got berries and cream, you make berries and cream-onade.

speaker: Justin
lines: Okay, that’s not how any of that works.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Uh, he’s asking you a question, and these two elves, which you kind of surmise just because they’re standing between you and him, are probably his bodyguards. Uh, the half-elf guy has his long-bow drawn on the three of you.

speaker: Lord Artemis Sterling
lines: Have you been following us this whole time? Answer me.

speaker: Magnus
lines: No?

speaker: Taako
lines: No.

speaker: Lord Artemis Sterling
lines: What brings you to the Felicity Wilds?

speaker: Magnus
lines: Wh—

speaker: Merle
lines: Big—big bubble.

speaker: Magnus
lines: We had a—

speaker: Taako
lines: It was a, yeah, a big bubble brought us.

speaker: Magnus
lines: Okay, wait, this, oh good, okay, this is a common misconception. Are you asking what conveyed us here, like through what method did we arrive, or for what purpose?

speaker: Lord Artemis Sterling
lines: [huff] What is your goal for being here? Why are you here?

speaker: Magnus
lines: Ah, see, that’s the confusion, guys. You thought that—

speaker: Merle
lines: Not to follow you. Hehe.

speaker: Magnus
lines: No, we’re here ‘cause the—the Wonderland...thing, and we’re gonna—

speaker: Griffin
lines: When you say that, he sort of stands up with a start, and walks over and whispers into the half-elf’s ear, and he says, Sterling says, uh,

speaker: Lord Artemis Sterling
lines: Turn around and leave these woods. Don’t try to follow us any further or my mercenaries will kill you.

speaker: Magnus
lines: Secrets– secrets are no fun.

speaker: Griffin
lines: When he says that the elves kind of like roll their eyes, um, and the half-elf man says,

speaker: Man
lines: Hey, are you guys, uh, are you guys mercs?

speaker: Taako
lines: Sort of.

speaker: Magnus
lines: Yeah.

speaker: Taako
lines: That’s as useful as—you know what, yeah.

speaker: Merle
lines: Potato, po-tah-to...

speaker: Taako
lines: Yeah, let’s go with mercs.

speaker: Magnus
lines: I mean, I’m a level ten fighter, level two rogue, so I think merc fits that pretty good.

speaker: Taako
lines: Aw, sure, yeah.

speaker: Man
lines: Nice, I’m a level 14 ranger.

speaker: Magnus
lines: Nice. High five.

speaker: Merle
lines: I’m a level 20 LIAR.

speaker: Magnus
lines: No, you’re not.

speaker: Griffin
lines: As you’re like talking to this half-elf who has sort of like a friendly demeanor, Lord Artemis Sterling seems like he’s kind of frustrated. Uh, and you also notice that he has and it’s weird, he has like, a beam of light? Coming out of him? That is like pointing him towards the woods? Like deeper into the woods? Uh—

speaker: Travis
lines: Is Artemis- Griffin, is Artemis armed?

speaker: Griffin
lines: Uh, yeah, he’s got a short bow on him. Um, and the elven woman turns to Sterling and is like,

speaker: Woman
lines: Listen, there’s no need for us to fight about anything, they’re just going to Wonderland, too. We can all go together and the next time a chimera comes around it’ll make the trip a little bit easier.

speaker: Griffin
lines: And, um, Sterling is kind of protesting. He does not want to roll with the three of y’all.

speaker: Merle
lines: Hey, look, Short Pants, let the adults take care of this, okay?

speaker: Lord Artemis Sterling
lines: How dare you, sir? Do you have any idea who I am?

speaker: Magnus
lines: [crosstalking] Um, Merle?

speaker: Merle
lines: No, actually, of the three of us, I’m the only one with a really bad perception roll, so, I have no idea.

speaker: Travis
lines: Oh yeah, that did happen!

speaker: Clint
lines: I don’t know who he is!

speaker: Lord Artemis Sterling
lines: I am Lord Artemis Sterling, the ruler of Highwinter. I keep saying Highwinter. Sometimes I call it- I’m trying to change the name of Neverwinter to Highwinter because I think it sounds funnier. Um, like a- like a weed joke. Anyway I don’t wanna—[whispering] I don’t wanna go with these guys, we don’t know them. They might just be following us, they might be trying to, they might be using us to get to Wonderland and then they’ll try and kill us! I don’t wanna go with these—

speaker: Taako
lines: Hey, listen, let’s get one thing straight We are gonna use you to get to Wonderland. But - we’re not gonna try to kill you once we’re there. So, that’s 50-50 I guess. That’s a win-win.

speaker: Magnus
lines: And you know what, you can use us, too. We’ll use each other. That’s what friendship is.

speaker: Griffin
lines: The ranger smiles and he lowers his bow, he’s like,

speaker: Man
lines: I like these guys. Let’s just go with them. Sterling, you gotta trust me on—you hired us to get you through these woods, and that means using all the resources at your disposal, and these boys look like good resources. Hey, do you guys want some jerky?

speaker: Griffin
lines: And he pulls some jerky out of—yeah.

speaker: Magnus
lines: I do! What’s your name, friend?

speaker: Griffin
lines: And he hands you—

speaker: Man
lines: Uh, my name is...let me try and look it up.

speaker: Magnus
lines: Okay?

speaker: Rowan
lines: Oh my name’s—my name’s Rowan! Yeah, I live here in these woods, and just tryna help get the boy-king here into Wonderland.

speaker: Magnus
lines: Rowan, you and I are gonna be BFFs. Should we come up with some kinda like secret handshake, or something?

speaker: Rowan
lines: I think we shouldn’t come up with it, I think let’s just put our hands together right now and see what happens.

speaker: Magnus
lines: Alright. Let’s do it.

speaker: Griffin
lines: You just do it.

speaker: Travis
lines: Is it amazing, Griffin?

speaker: Griffin
lines: It’s am—it’s a 14-step secret handshake and it’s really, really great. Um, the druid woman walks over to you, Merle, and like, without saying a word, just kind of grabs your Soulwood arm and like, starts like, inspecting it. She’s like,

speaker: Woman
lines: Are you—are you like a—are you part dryad? Are you- are you a tree folk? What is this? This is awesome!

speaker: Merle
lines: You’ve heard of having a green thumb?

speaker: Woman
lines: Yeah?

speaker: Merle
lines: Eh, this, this was just like a green thumb thing gone totally wrong. Nah. No, Pan gave me this. My god, Pan. Ah, well, he allowed it to happen.

speaker: Woman
lines: Aw, I like Pan.

speaker: Griffin
lines: She smiles, and lets go of your arm. She’s like—

speaker: Travis
lines: Dad, have you been sick? Because your voice is evolving into like a really cool level. I’m really digging it.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Yeah, it’s really neat.

speaker: Clint
lines: I am really sick, thank you for asking.

speaker: Travis
lines: Yeah, you sound super cool.

speaker: Griffin
lines: She releases your arm, and she looks a little bit disappointed, she’s like,

speaker: Woman
lines: Oh, that’s- I mean, it’s cool, I was—I was hoping it was sort of a dryad situation. But, uh—

speaker: Taako
lines: Yeah, it’s, uh—

speaker: Merle
lines: It is! It is! I’ve got like a third cousin that’s, uh, 60% dryad.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Okay, that’s—

speaker: Taako
lines: He’s like a tree-borg.

speaker: Clint
lines: Tree-borg! Ooh, I’m stealing that. Tree-borg.

speaker: Justin
lines: I’ve been sitting here for three minutes trying to come up with something better than “tree-borg”.

speaker: Justin
lines: “Tree” doesn’t rhyme with “cy”, it’s a stupid pun, it’s like not even a pun.

speaker: Travis
lines: Dryborg. Dryborg.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Dryborg’s pretty good.

speaker: Justin
lines: Dryborg. [disappointed] Dryborg’s not bad. That’s better.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Um, so, I think while you guys are sort of getting to know these two—

speaker: Travis
lines: Big Bad Treetleborgs.

speaker: Justin
lines: Okay. [disgruntled]

speaker: Clint
lines: Sycamore-borg!

speaker: Griffin
lines: Alright we’re done.

speaker: Justin
lines: Now we’re just saying things.

speaker: Griffin
lines: While uh, while you three are getting to know these elves, I think Sterling just kinda starts to walk off into the woods, uh, and as he goes the two elves kind of chase after him. And the six of you make your way through the Felicity Wilds. And it’s a quiet trip, there’s no more three-headed monstrosities to fight on your trek to Wonderland—

speaker: Justin
lines: Hey, on the way, can I ask Sterling—

speaker: Griffin
lines: Yeah.

speaker: Justin
lines: —what’s up with the beam of light?

speaker: Griffin
lines: Uh, he says,

speaker: Lord Artemis Sterling
lines: It’s—it’s none of your business, okay. It’s my way of finding Wonderland, alright?

speaker: Taako
lines: Oh, so just follow the weird Care Bear Stare you got kickin’ there, and it’ll get us safely there, right?

speaker: Griffin
lines: He sighs and he’s like,

speaker: Lord Artemis Sterling
lines: Yeah, that’s the idea.

speaker: Griffin
lines: And he keeps walking.

speaker: Travis
lines: During this, Rowan and Magnus are just trading jerky stories.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Yeah.

speaker: Travis
lines: Different places where they’ve had jerky, different kinds of jerky they’ve had.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Yeah.

speaker: Clint
lines: Rephrase that a little.

speaker: Travis
lines: I will not.

speaker: Griffin
lines: No, he will not rephrase that.

speaker: Travis
lines: I said what I said and I am standing by it.

speaker: Griffin
lines: So yeah your trip is, uh, aside from Sterling who’s kind of a heel, you get to know these other two elves Rowan and Antonia and you all kind of have a lot in common. They are mercenaries, uh, hired to get him through the forest and they’re pretty friendly. Um, Merle, you and Antonia spend of a lot of time just talkin’ tree, and you share some jerky with Rowan, and you all have a fairly good time, and after about a half day’s journey, you reach a clearing. And it’s a huge clearing, actually, it’s carved out of the forest in a perfect circle. And in the middle of that circle is Wonderland.

speaker: And it’s a squat, wide, cylindrical building with these large floodlights positioned all around it, shining on its surface. And the building, the exterior of the building is painted in these vertical white and black stripes, um, but it’s not-- you realize it’s not paint because that pattern is actually moving? It’s like, spinning in a circle, like rotating around the exterior of this cylinder, and it almost looks like a giant roulette wheel. And… you notice that Artemis’s beam is leading you down a dirt path towards Wonderland, and as you look around this clearing you realize it’s one of maybe a dozen dirt paths all leading from different parts of the woods directly towards Wonderland.

And you actually see on a couple of the paths, you see a couple other beams of light, apparently leading other people in from the woods as if this thing is like, attracting folks from all over. Uh, and the dirt path that you are sort of directed down is lined with billboards. Big, tall billboards. And they are kind of- the design of them is just as gaudy and loud as the flyer invitation that the Director showed you, and it’s showcasing the prizes awaiting within. And you see your names—Taako, Merle, Magnus—on a big billboard, and you see the Animus Bell on your billboard and it looks exactly like it did on the Director’s invitation. But there’s three other billboards also, uh.

You see one with Sterling’s name on it. And on Sterling’s billboard there’s a big, intricately sort of crafted glass vial of silvery liquid, and the billboard calls this vial “Miracle Milk.” And he kind of gasps when he sees it and motions to the mercs. And they have their own billboards, too. Antonia has a billboard with an anatomically correct heart made out of gnarled wood? And it’s called the “Heart of the Forest.” And she kind of, when she sees this, she goes,
Antonia
lines: Huh. I didn’t think I would have one.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Uh, and then there’s a billboard for Rowan, too, and it has just a plain leather band on it and it’s labeled “Carmine’s Collar.” And he just kind of, when he sees it he just goes like,

speaker: Rowan
lines: Huh. Interesting.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Um, and so, that is the approach into Wonderland, and the other three people in your party start walking in towards—

speaker: Travis
lines: Wait, hold on, hold on.

speaker: Justin
lines: And as I peer out into the darkness, I see there’s one for Merle. And it’s a—a prosthetic penis. It’s so strange, it’s like, “Replace what you have lost and perhaps never had.”

speaker: Griffin
lines: Like his weiner got taken away?

speaker: Justin
lines: “Prosthetic Penis Today.” Yeah.

speaker: Clint
lines: When did that happen?

speaker: Griffin
lines: I don’t remember his weiner getting…

speaker: Justin
lines: I’m just reading the billboard. I’m just looking at the billboard.

speaker: Travis
lines: Don’t you remember—it’s in one of those bonus episodes we’ve recorded that hasn’t aired yet. You’ll hear it. You’ll hear it.

speaker: Clint
lines: Ohhhh.

speaker: Griffin
lines: When the weiner-grabber came and he took, he took your weiner away to the Weiner Dimension.

speaker: Justin
lines: [in a horrible voice] “Hi, everybody, I got another weiner!”

speaker: Griffin
lines: That sounds like Mickey Mouse. Now it’s like a Kingdom Hearts thing.

speaker: Justin
lines: [in a creepily accurate Mickey Mouse impression] “Hey! I got your weiner!”

speaker: Travis
lines: People keep wondering when the two shows will cross over and here it is, right here.

speaker: Justin
lines: “Here it is! I’m gonna give this weiner to my buddy Toodles! He’s gonna take it away forever!”

speaker: Magnus
lines: Uh, now, everybody, hold on just one moment. Uh, this seems a little simple, doesn’t it?

speaker: Rowan
lines: Yeah, I mean, you guys get that this is a big trap, right? Like.

speaker: Taako
lines: Oh yeah.

speaker: Rowan
lines: Like, it’s a hugely, deadly trap.

speaker: Magnus
lines: Yeah, but like, but like, this whole walkway is lined with like, “Yeah, everything’s gonna be like—here’s your prizes, just walk on through!”

speaker: Taako
lines: Yeah, but it’s like a trap. Like, we have been, Rowan, referring to this little adventure of ours as “The Suffering Game.” It’s a nickname we came up with. We don’t even know why we’re calling it that, we just kinda feel like it’s gonna go bad.

speaker: Rowan
lines: Um, yeah, I mean it’s not great, but the money is really good for this job? And now that I know that that collar’s in there, I kinda can’t not go in?

speaker: Magnus
lines: I understand. Wait right here for just one second.

speaker: Travis
lines: And Magnus pulls out his shield and just sprints down the path.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Okay. Doing what?

speaker: Travis
lines: Just kind of like—

speaker: Clint
lines: Being stupid?

speaker: Travis
lines: No, you know, bobbing and weaving, serpentine. Lots of unnecessary rolls.

speaker: Griffin
lines: [amused] Alright, you do some fucking Paul Blart Mall Cop-style antics as you roll and bob and weave your way down the path. And there’s no land mines. There’s no trip wires. You just make it to the building and the other five people are just like looking at you, I guess.

speaker: Magnus
lines: [calling out] Everything’s cool! I thought there might- I thought there might be traps! But everything’s fine!

speaker: Griffin
lines: Yep.

speaker: Taako
lines: So you thought the trap would be in the road to the trap?

speaker: Magnus
lines: I just—I thought it seemed pretty simple? ‘Cause it was just like a pathway? And we started with like a fight in the thing, so I thought maybe there’d be more things? You know what, in retrospect, I realize how that looked.

speaker: Taako
lines: So cool, is your answer, it looked so cool.

speaker: Griffin
lines: So, do you, I’m guessing the rest of you follow down the approach now that there’s no—confirmed no—

speaker: Justin
lines: At regular speed. Like regular adult speed.

speaker: Clint
lines: No cartwheels.

speaker: Justin
lines: No flip-flops.

speaker: Clint
lines: No rolls.

speaker: Justin
lines: No stunts.

speaker: Griffin
lines: You, uh, okay. You make it to the building and the pattern, this black and white roulette wheel pattern, stops spinning. And it, uh, you see a black segment has stopped sort of in your direction, and…

speaker: Justin
lines: Did it stop spinning for us? Like does it seem to have stopped because we approached it?

speaker: Griffin
lines: Yeah. Yeah.

speaker: Justin
lines: Okay, is it all leading to a central—are all these different roads leading to like a central entrance?

speaker: Griffin
lines: Yeah, that’s leading to this huge, cylindrical building. And as the wheel stops on this black segment, um, a portion of the wall just sort of slides away? And all of a sudden there is an entrance into the building and through that—

speaker: Travis
lines: So, what you’ve been describing Griffin, just so I know I can picture it correctly, is kind of like a kinetoscope? Where like it’s segmented and if you’re looking it’s spinning past going white-black-white-black-white-black, right?

speaker: Griffin
lines: Yeah, kind of, kind of.

speaker: Travis
lines: Okay. And it stopped on a specific segment when we walked up?

speaker: Griffin
lines: Uh-huh. And this door, this doorway opens in the wall, and three  names appear above it. And the names are Antonia, Rowan, and Lord Artemis Sterling. And Sterling doesn’t say anything, he doesn’t wish you guys goodbye, he doesn’t even address you, he’s sort of continuing his streak of being a dick that he’s carried on throughout your journey through the woods, and he just walks in, and Rowan sighs, and he says,

speaker: Rowan
lines: Well, guys, I guess I’ll see you on the other side. Oh!

speaker: Griffin
lines: He reaches into his bag and he pulls out a small container of extra jerky and he hands it to you, Magnus, and he says,

speaker: Rowan
lines: In case you guys get hungry in there.

speaker: Travis
lines: And I reach into my bag and I pull out a small, carved wooden duck.

speaker: Griffin
lines: And he says, uh,

speaker: Rowan
lines: Wow, this is great! Antonia, did you see this?

speaker: Magnus
lines: I made that just for you, buddy. While we were walking.

speaker: Griffin
lines: She’s uh—

speaker: Magnus
lines: I carved it while I was rolling down the pathway.

speaker: Griffin
lines: And Rowan walks into the door, and sort of disappears into that black space.

speaker: Justin
lines: Does there seem to be any interaction between the light and the roulette wheel, or was that really just guiding him to the wheel?

speaker: Griffin
lines: It was just sort of guiding him in like it was, it was—

speaker: Justin
lines: It didn’t seem like a key or anything? It just seemed to--

speaker: Griffin
lines: No, it’s almost like a siren song. Like you follow the light to… to Wonderland.

speaker: Clint
lines: Can we see the other people going in the other entrances from the other paths?

speaker: Griffin
lines: No, there’s nobody else making their approach in this clearing right now. They’re just like, on their way, you kind of assume.

speaker: Clint
lines: [crosstalk] Okay.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Um, and Antonia says,

speaker: Antonia
lines: Well, good luck, boys. Uh, sorry about Lord Sterling. He’s kinda… kind of a ding dong.

speaker: Taako
lines: Eh. We’re used to it.

speaker: Antonia
lines: I hope we’ll see you guys again. Good luck in there.

speaker: Taako
lines: Best of luck.

speaker: Merle
lines: Smell ya later.

speaker: Magnus
lines: Peace.

speaker: Griffin
lines: She walks into the roulette wheel and the door closes, and the names disappear, and they’re gone. And then the wheel spins some more, and it ends after a few rotations on a white space, and another door appears, and this one has your guys’ names on it. And there’s nothing beyond it except just inky blackness.

speaker: Clint
lines: So, it’s a white door with inky blackness?

speaker: Griffin
lines: Yeah. Like, it’s not like—it’s not just dark inside, it is black. Like it’s like you’re—yeah. It’s kind of less like a doorway and more like a portal.

speaker: Travis
lines: Magnus is already inside.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Oh. Shit, okay.

speaker: Clint
lines: Merle turns and says,

speaker: Merle
lines: Hey, Magnus, do you uh—what the hell?

speaker: Taako
lines: Yeah, I’m not sure about this one, fellas. I mean, I’m trying to be true to Taako, aaaaand this seems wack as all hell.

speaker: Travis
lines: Griffin, can I step back out real quick?

speaker: Griffin
lines: Uh, yeah.

speaker: Travis
lines: I grab Taako and run inside.

speaker: Taako
lines: Son of a bitch!

speaker: Griffin
lines: Uh, okay. Merle, you followin’ suit?

speaker: Clint
lines: [sighs, pause] Yeah, I waddle on in.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Okay. As soon as you’re through the passageway, uh, you look behind you, and it’s like, it wasn’t even like a door shut menacingly behind you, the d—it’s just not there. You are—you are in a chamber that is so dark you can barely see. Even those of you with Dark Vision, I think, uh everybody but Magnus has special eyes that they can see in the dark. You can’t really see much of anything, um, you can just kind of make out the shapes of things. You can tell it’s a huge, huge chamber, bigger even than it appeared on the outside, but after a few moments everything is illuminated.

speaker: Griffin
lines: There’s a row of spotlights on the ceiling that click on, and these two big rotating floodlights on the ground that activate and shine upwards, and they cross on the center of the chamber and you see two figures standing on a long, elevated platform. Uh, they are beautiful elves, one female, one male, uh, and they are dressed in these tight-fitting, high-fashion garments of gold and green and violet. He’s wearing a golden half-cape, with fur trim, and she’s wearing these huge, insane, golden shoulder pads. And you realize the long platform they’re standing on is a runway. And the—the female elf sticks a slender, gloved arm into the air and snaps.

speaker: [Storm Top Dog by Zackery Wilson plays]
Griffin
lines: And all of a sudden the ceiling and walls and floors of this room transform into a thousand multicolored neon panels that shift and flash in time with the loud pulsating music that floods the chamber. And every time like, every time that the beat hits on this song, the spotlights flash in time, and every time they do they catch this duo as they just fuckin’ vogue and pose their way down the runway, just like, working it. Just like hitting the beat so fucking hard and just voguing their brains out. Um…

speaker: Justin
lines: This should go without saying at this point. Taako is delighted.

speaker: Justin

speaker: Clint
lines: [gasps] Crit 20.

speaker: Justin
lines: Oh, oh, that’s a-flashing Nat 20.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Oh, really?

speaker: Taako
lines: Actually, I know exactly what the fuck that is.

speaker: Taako
lines: No probs. Let me open my mouth, and my voice might sound different, but I’m about to say something very smart about it. Here I go.

speaker: Griffin
lines: So here’s what I’ll tell you because that roll is too good for me to not tell you something. You noticed it too, you noticed this, it’s like a dark fog that came out of their mouths, and whenever Magnus, you know, kind of groused about getting his pinky chopped off, and when Merle was talking about how much this sucks, you saw this dark fog come out of their mouths. And whenever they said it, you don’t know like what’s causing it, but it is some sort of necrotic energy. That is leaving them and sort of being spirited away somewhere here in Wonderland.

speaker: Clint
lines: Taako didn’t even wanna come in!

speaker: Taako
lines: Mm-hmm. So, here’s my best guess, boys. My best guess is that this place—

speaker: Magnus
lines: Wait, hold on, hold on. Pocket spa. Step in here with me real quick.

speaker: Taako
lines: ...Okay.

speaker: Magnus
lines: Or pocket workshop.

speaker: Taako
lines: Yeah, let’s go to the spa, please. I need a break.

speaker: Justin
lines: Alright, so, the pocket spa’s open, and we can walk into the pocket spa.

speaker: Taako
lines: So, before we move on, uh, so here’s my…

speaker: Griffin
lines: What is that noise? It’s not in a canyon.

speaker: Justin
lines: It’s a spa.

speaker: Clint
lines: No, that’s, that’s 528 hertz. In case you don’t know, that’s the miracle tone that is supposed to enable you to relax.

speaker: Justin
lines: Um. So this is very soothing.

speaker: Taako
lines: So here’s my best guess This place isn’t trying to kill us…

speaker: Magnus
lines: Uh-huh.

speaker: Taako
lines: It just wants to make us miserable…

speaker: Magnus
lines: Uh-huh.

speaker: Taako
lines: And it seems like it’s feeding off of that. That’s my best guess. This is a place designed to make us miserable and it’s—every time that we vocalize that, it knows that it is succeeding and it’s feeding off of that energy. That’s my best guess.

speaker: Magnus
lines: I like that. So do you think it’s better to give it what it wants? Or to stay super positive?

speaker: Taako
lines: What am I, a fuckin’ necrotic energy whisperer? I have no idea.

speaker: Magnus
lines: Listen, this is—we very rarely talk through this kind of shit, I’m very much enjoying it, just trying to get a vibe on where you’re at.

speaker: Merle
lines: I’m really uncomfortable with it. Let’s get out of here.

speaker: Taako
lines: I mean, I will say this. I don’t see any reason to feed it if we don’t have to. I mean it’s very much not in our nature to not grouse about but maybe we should try to stay posi about this whole experience.

speaker: Magnus
lines: Yeah, let’s swing towards the positive side of things. Alright, let’s do this.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Okay. You make your way back out of the pocket spa and into the decision room again, and are you moving onto the next chamber?

speaker: Travis
lines: Yes, of course we are!

speaker: Griffin
lines: Okay.

speaker: Taako
lines: Here we go!

speaker: Clint
lines: Wheeeee!

speaker: Griffin
lines: Uh, you move through the door and you are in another circular room.

speaker: Travis
lines: Yay, awesome!

speaker: Clint
lines: Yahoo!

speaker: Griffin
lines: It’s also very like, neon-bright. And above you the whole ceiling is nothing but machinery that is attached to the ceiling. And it’s this huge, heavy manufacturing like, assembly line machinery.

speaker: Clint
lines: Awesome.

speaker: Griffin
lines: And it all connects sort of in a spiral, and in the center of the ceiling is a large, circular hatch. And as you enter into the room, the doorway disappears behind you, and with three, loud clunks, three, large boxes fall from the ceiling and land on the ground.

speaker: Travis
lines: Super cool!

speaker: Griffin
lines: And each box has a—these boxes are perfect cubes, and each box has a word etched on a side, and the words are things like “fiery” and “quick” and some other adjectives and nouns. And you hear a voice say,

speaker: Male Elf
lines: Welcome...to the Monster Factory! [Justin laughs] This is so exciting. Each of you will roll these dice in front of you and you will build a bespoke foe to square off against. It could be something new altogether, nobody knows!

speaker: Clint
lines: Whoo.

speaker: Travis
lines: Sounds fun!

speaker: Male Elf
lines: Now, based on the consequences of the Decision Game, there will be some… difficulties imposed on you during this challenge, but let’s not worry about that. Let’s roll those bones.

speaker: Travis
lines: Sounds good.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Let’s do this one at a time. You’re gonna roll a D6, tell me who wants to go first, and then, pop it in the, Skype and I’ll, paste something in there for you.

speaker: Merle
lines: I’ll go first.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Alright.

speaker: Clint
lines: That’s Merle, for those listeners who can’t tell the difference between our voices.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Alright, your dice, Merle, the one that you go pick up, has the name of some monsters on it, so go ahead and roll that.

speaker: Clint
lines: Two.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Uh, that is—you roll the big, big box, and it lands on the word “slime.” And that box turns green and disappears.

speaker: Magnus
lines: I will go.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Okay, here are your words. You pick up a dice just covered in these different adjectives.

speaker: Travis
lines: I rolled a three.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Uh, “poisonous.” So, “poisonous” and “slime” are the words so far. And, Taako? Here are your words.

speaker: Justin
lines: Five.

speaker: Griffin
lines: “Regenerating.” Uh, so you get “regenerating, poisonous slime.”

speaker: Travis
lines: Cool!

speaker: Taako
lines: Great!

speaker: Travis
lines: Awesome.

speaker: Merle
lines: Yayyyy!

speaker: Magnus
lines: Yeah, fun!

speaker: Taako
lines: That could have gone so much worse.

speaker: Travis
lines: Yeah, there’s “dragon” and “dire bear” and stuff on there.

speaker: Griffin
lines: And you hear a voice… The machinery above you on the right side of the room kicks into gear, and you hear pistons firing, and you hear steam being blown—

speaker: [Travis makes sounds of INDUSTRY, as heard in “Murder on the Rockport Limited, Chapter Two”]
Griffin
lines: Yeah, you hear the sounds of industry. [Clint laughs] Um, but you hear the woman say,

speaker: Female Elf
lines: Aw, that’s so disappointing. I’ve seen a regenerating poisonous slime before.

speaker: Griffin
lines: And you hear the man say,

speaker: Male Elf
lines: Oh, well that’s nothing to worry about. They didn’t win the decision game. So they’re gonna do it again.

speaker: Griffin
lines: And three more dice fall down from the ceiling.

speaker: Taako
lines: Son of a—

speaker: Magnus
lines: No, what fun!

speaker: Merle
lines: [under breath] Dammit. [normal voice] Yay!

speaker: Magnus
lines: A second chance at a first impression!

speaker: Griffin
lines: Taako, like a little bit, just like a little bit of that dark fog came out of your mouth.

speaker: Taako
lines: Dammit.

speaker: Griffin
lines: ...and floated up into the ceiling. And a little bit more went up.

speaker: Taako
lines: Fuck!

speaker: Griffin
lines: No joke, every time you do that just like a little bit more goes up into the ceiling.

speaker: Taako
lines: Alright, yeah. Yeah, I’ll just be Zen about it.

speaker: Magnus
lines: Okay, I’ll roll first this time.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Okay.

speaker: Travis
lines: Four.

speaker: Griffin
lines: “Dire bear.”

speaker: Travis
lines: What fun!

speaker: Griffin
lines: Who’s rollin’ the second dice—

speaker: Justin
lines: Two.

speaker: Griffin
lines: “Electrified”, holy shit. Uh, Merle?

speaker: Clint
lines: Two.

speaker: Griffin
lines: “Flying,” HOLY SHIT! A flying, electrified dire bear, now we’re talkin’! Hold on, sorry, that’s in character.

speaker: Male Elf
lines: Fuck yeah! A flying, electrified dire bear! Wonderful! That would be what you would have to face if you both chose “betray”, but unfortunately you all are getting the sharp end of the stick, so to speak. So, one more dice.

speaker: Griffin
lines: And another dice falls down from the ceiling, um, I’m not actually gonna show you what’s on this dice? Why don’t-- uh, who wants to roll it?

speaker: Magnus
lines: Uh, Taako?

speaker: Taako
lines: Sure.

speaker: Justin
lines: Five.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Uh… [laughs]. Okay, uh, the word pops up, and it applies to both of the creations that you’ve created so far. And as soon as it lands, I think you all look at it in horror and you hear the elves kind of squee in delight. Because—and I think you hear the man say uh,

speaker: Male Elf
lines: Oh, this is delicious! Not only are you facing off against a regenerating, poisonous slime and a flying, electrified dire bear, you’re going to face off against… multiplying regenerating, poisonous slimes and multiplying flying, electrified dire bears. This is gonna get zany!

speaker: Griffin
lines: —he says, and after a few more seconds of the machinery above you processing things, sure enough, falling down through that hatch is a cube of slime that is giving off a horrible, horrible stench that is about fifteen feet tall that slorps down to the ground, and then right behind it with a pair of beautiful, beautiful, angelic wings is a humongous dire bear with bolts of crackling electricity sort of wrapping around its body, and they roar at you. Let’s roll initiative.

speaker: [Maximum Fun promos
lines: MaxFunCon 2017 tickets ad, PopRocket ad]
